   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% This module tests the orddict, dict, and gb_trees modules.
   22: %%
   23: 
   24: -module(dict_SUITE).
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   28: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   29: 	 create/1,store/1,iterate/1,remove/1]).
   30: 
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: 
   33: -import(lists, [foldl/3]).
   34: 
   35: suite() ->
   36:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   37:      {timetrap,{minutes,5}}].
   38: 
   39: all() -> 
   40:     [create, store, remove, iterate].
   41: 
   42: groups() -> 
   43:     [].
   44: 
   45: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   46:     Config.
   47: 
   48: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   49:     ok.
   50: 
   51: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   52:     Config.
   53: 
   54: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: 
   58: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   62:     ok.
   63: 
   64: create(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   65:     test_all(fun create_1/1).
   66: 
   67: create_1(M) ->
   68:     D0 = M(empty, []),
   69:     [] = M(to_list, D0),
   70:     0 = M(size, D0),
   71:     true = M(is_empty, D0),
   72:     D0.
   73: 
   74: store(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   75:     test_all([{0,132},{253,258},{510,514}], fun store_1/2).
   76: 
   77: store_1(List, M) ->
   78:     D0 = M(from_list, List),
   79: 
   80:     %% Make sure that we get the same result by inserting
   81:     %% elements one at the time.
   82:     D1 = foldl(fun({K,V}, Dict) -> M(enter, {K,V,Dict}) end,
   83: 	       M(empty, []), List),
   84:     true = M(equal, {D0,D1}),
   85:     case List of
   86: 	[] ->
   87: 	    true = M(is_empty, D0),
   88: 	    true = M(is_empty, D1);
   89: 	[_|_] ->
   90: 	    false = M(is_empty, D0),
   91: 	    false = M(is_empty, D1)
   92:     end,
   93:     D0.
   94: 
   95: remove(_Config) ->
   96:     test_all([{0,87}], fun remove_1/2).
   97: 
   98: remove_1(List0, M) ->
   99:     %% Make sure that keys are unique. Randomize key order.
  100:     List1 = orddict:from_list(List0),
  101:     List2 = lists:sort([{rand:uniform(),E} || E <- List1]),
  102:     List = [E || {_,E} <- List2],
  103:     D0 = M(from_list, List),
  104:     remove_2(List, D0, M).
  105: 
  106: remove_2([{Key,Val}|T], D0, M) ->
  107:     {Val,D1} = M(take, {Key,D0}),
  108:     error = M(take, {Key,D1}),
  109:     D2 = M(erase, {Key,D0}),
  110:     true = M(equal, {D1,D2}),
  111:     remove_2(T, D1, M);
  112: remove_2([], D, M) ->
  113:     true = M(is_empty, D),
  114:     D.
  115: 
  116: %%%
  117: %%% Test specifics for gb_trees.
  118: %%%
  119: 
  120: iterate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     test_all(fun iterate_1/1).
  122: 
  123: iterate_1(M) ->
  124:     case M(module, []) of
  125: 	gb_trees -> iterate_2(M);
  126: 	_ -> ok
  127:     end,
  128:     M(empty, []).
  129: 
  130: iterate_2(M) ->
  131:     rand:seed(exsplus, {1,2,42}),
  132:     iter_tree(M, 1000).
  133: 
  134: iter_tree(_M, 0) ->
  135:     ok;
  136: iter_tree(M, N) ->
  137:     L = [{I, I} || I <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  138:     T = M(from_list, L),
  139:     L = lists:reverse(iterate_tree(M, T)),
  140:     R = rand:uniform(N),
  141:     KV = lists:reverse(iterate_tree_from(M, R, T)),
  142:     KV = [P || P={K,_} <- L, K >= R],
  143:     iter_tree(M, N-1).
  144: 
  145: iterate_tree(M, Tree) ->
  146:     I = M(iterator, Tree),
  147:     iterate_tree_1(M, M(next, I), []).
  148: 
  149: iterate_tree_from(M, Start, Tree) ->
  150:     I = M(iterator_from, {Start, Tree}),
  151:     iterate_tree_1(M, M(next, I), []).
  152: 
  153: iterate_tree_1(_, none, R) ->
  154:     R;
  155: iterate_tree_1(M, {K, V, I}, R) ->
  156:     iterate_tree_1(M, M(next, I), [{K, V} | R]).
  157: 
  158: %%%
  159: %%% Helper functions.
  160: %%%
  161: 
  162: dict_mods() ->
  163:     Orddict = dict_test_lib:new(orddict, fun(X, Y) -> X == Y end),
  164:     Dict = dict_test_lib:new(dict, fun(X, Y) ->
  165: 					   lists:sort(dict:to_list(X)) == 
  166: 					       lists:sort(dict:to_list(Y)) end),
  167:     Gb = dict_test_lib:new(gb_trees, fun(X, Y) ->
  168: 					     gb_trees:to_list(X) == 
  169: 						 gb_trees:to_list(Y) end),
  170:     [Orddict,Dict,Gb].
  171: 
  172: test_all(Tester) ->
  173:     Pids = [spawn_tester(M, Tester) || M <- dict_mods()],
  174:     collect_all(Pids, []).
  175: 
  176: spawn_tester(M, Tester) ->
  177:     Parent = self(),
  178:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  179: 		       rand:seed(exsplus, {1,2,42}),
  180: 		       S = Tester(M),
  181: 		       Res = {M(size, S),lists:sort(M(to_list, S))},
  182: 		       Parent ! {result,self(),Res}
  183: 	       end).
  184: 
  185: collect_all([Pid|Pids], Acc) ->
  186:     receive
  187: 	{result,Pid,Result} ->
  188: 	    collect_all(Pids, [Result|Acc])
  189:     end;
  190: collect_all([], Acc) ->
  191:     all_same(Acc).
  192: 
  193: test_all(ListTemplate, Tester) ->
  194:     List = random_list(ListTemplate),
  195:     test_all(fun(M) -> Tester(List, M) end).
  196: 
  197: all_same([H|T]) ->
  198:     all_same_1(T, H).
  199: 
  200: all_same_1([H|T], H) ->
  201:     all_same_1(T, H);
  202: all_same_1([], _) -> ok.
  203: 
  204: rnd_list(Sz) ->
  205:     rnd_list_1(Sz, []).
  206: 
  207: random_list([{Low,High}|T]) ->
  208:     random_list(lists:seq(Low, High)++T);
  209: random_list([Sz|T]) when is_integer(Sz) ->
  210:     rnd_list(Sz)++random_list(T);
  211: random_list([]) -> [].
  212: 
  213: rnd_list_1(0, Acc) ->
  214:     Acc;
  215: rnd_list_1(N, Acc) ->
  216:     Key = atomic_rnd_term(),
  217:     Value = rand:uniform(100),
  218:     rnd_list_1(N-1, [{Key,Value}|Acc]).
  219: 
  220: atomic_rnd_term() ->
  221:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  222: 	 1 -> list_to_atom(integer_to_list($\s+rand:uniform(94))++"rnd");
  223: 	 2 -> rand:uniform();
  224: 	 3 -> rand:uniform(50)-37
  225:     end.
